Where flight control goes after a mission to blow off steam?

**Edited <time datetime="2016-01-13T23:59:14Z" title="01/13/2016 11:59  PM" data-short="8 yr">January 13, 2016</time> by sj176**

Hmmmm, I wonder why they need to do seismic surveys there? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

JR

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-18T22:10:50Z" title="07/18/2015 10:10  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 18, 2015</time> by Jolly\_Roger**
I could see doing an atmospheric survey. You know, check out the atmosphere in the place... decor, music, clients. Maybe even extensive fluid analysis.
Shh, that's nothing you need to know about.

> 
> Hmmmm, I wonder why they need to do seismic surveys there? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> JR

'cause they suspect that place ROCKS!
Probably it looks like Gene already was.

> 
> Has Jeb been there recently

No, but they heard he will be soon and want to get the seismographs placed beforehand. You know, to see what... uhm... impact he has on the place when he arrives. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> 'cause they suspect that place ROCKS!

Yes, they've heard that place rocks, and they want to precisely quantify how rocking it is.
Maybe they want to know if nearby rocket launches affect "stirred, not shaked" drinks ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
A seismic survey on the toilets
Everything in this thread is brilliant.
Its competing with the launchpad bar for customers
Just don't ask about their meatloaf.
